thread.title: Girls soccer: MKA tops Livingston to improve to 13-0
thread.title_full: Girls soccer: MKA tops Livingston to improve to 13-0

title: Girls soccer: MKA tops Livingston to improve to 13-0
text:
Girls soccer: MKA tops Livingston to improve to 13-0 October 22, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 22, 2015, 12:32 AM The Montclair Times Print 
Senior forward Olivia Vaughn scored her team-best 20th goal of the season and the Montclair Kimberley Academy girls soccer team took advantage of an own goal to remain perfect on the season, thanks to a 2-1 win over Livingston Monday night in Livingston. 
The Cougars (13-0), the champions of the Super Essex Conference’s second tier, the Liberty Division, defeated the American Division’s Lancers for the second straight year. 
Monday’s game snapped a 12-game unbeaten streak for Livingston (8-2-3) dating back to Sept. 11, including the Lancers’ 1-1 draw with Montclair on Oct. 8. 
MKA opens up Essex County Tournament play this Saturday, Oct. 24, with a home match against the winner of yesterday’s Caldwell-West Orange clash. 
The third-seeded Cougars will look to advance to the semifinals this Wednesday, Oct. 28, at Millburn High. The winner of Saturday’s MKA match will play at 5 p.m. against either second-seeded Glen Ridge or 10th-seeded Columbia.
